captions.text:
00:02
COMM: From a distance it looks like any other

car, but here in Los Angeles, two engineers
haw turned a Cadillac into a fully functioning

00:11
COMM: Phil Weicker and Duncan Forster bought

the 1969 Cadillac Coupe DeVille for just $800
six years ago.

00:19
COMM: Improving the suspension controls they

stripped out and re-enforced the frame of
the car, fitting a custom built fibreglass

tub, to tale the added weight of the foaming
water.

00:33
COMM: The Cadillac, which they hope will top

100mph when full of water, uses it's original
472 V8 engine to heat the water in tub to

00:46
COMM: And a pool pump and filter were fitted

into the car's boot. The pair now plan to
race the turbo tub, affectionally named the

Carpool DeVille at Boneville Speedway, Utah
in August. Where they hope to set the land
speed record for the world's fastest hot tub.

title: Hot Tub Cadillac: Friends Hope To Set World Record For Fastest Hot Tub Car
